library.description:
Mousetrap is a simple library for handling keyboard shortcuts in Javascript.

It is around 1.7kb minified and gzipped and 3kb minified, has no external dependencies, and has been tested in the following browsers:

Internet Explorer 6+
Safari
Firefox
Chrome
It has support for keypress, keydown, and keyup events on specific keys, keyboard combinations, or key sequences.
library.name: Mousetrap

library.description:
Keymaster is a simple (100 LoC or so) micro-library for defining and dispatching keyboard shortcuts. It has no dependencies.

Itâ€™s a work in progress (e.g. beta), so spare me your nerdrage and instead contribute! Patches are welcome, but they are not guaranteed to make it in.
library.name: keymaster.js

library.description: jQuery Hotkeys is a plug-in that lets you easily add and remove handlers for keyboard events anywhere in your code supporting almost any key combination.
library.name: jQuery Hotkeys

library.description: Keypress is a robust keyboard input capturing Javascript utility focused on input for games. For details and documentation, please visit http://dmauro.github.io/Keypress/.
library.name: Keypress

library.description:
KeyboardJS will allow you to bind to any key the browser can detect. It allows for setting up complex key combos or even single key binds with ease. It is aware of combo overlap and will not fire simpler combos or single key bindings when they share key with larger combos.

Basically if you want to use the keyboard, this will let you do it without restrictions.

KeyboardJS has full support for AMD module loaders such as RequireJS.
library.name: KeyboardJS

library.description:
jwerty is a JS lib which allows you to bind, fire and assert key combination strings against elements and events. It normalises the poor std api into something easy to use and clear.

jwerty is a small library, weighing in at around 1.5kb bytes minified and gzipped (~3kb minified). jwerty has no dependencies, but is compatible with jQuery, Zepto or Ender if you include those packages alongside it.
library.name: Jwerty

library.description: Kibo is a simple JavaScript library for handling keyboard events.
library.name: Kibo

library.description: Easy keybindings for browser applications!
library.name: keys.js

library.description: Key shortcuts made simple
library.name: jKey

library.description:
Keyboard short cuts for paging through listings one item at at time (and across entire pages). Inspired by the navigation at FFFFOUND!

The example operates on micro-formatted html ( hAtom ). The script uses either the prototype or jquery js libraries and hotkey.js for key event hooks. Take a look at this video explanation from Ryan Singer of 37 Signals
library.name: Paging Keys

library.description: Keymage is a small library for handling key bindings in JavaScript. No dependencies, supports key sequences, nested scopes, etc.
library.name: keymage

library.description:
This Firefox add-on allows the user to customize shortcuts. It also helps to discover already existing shortcuts.

detect and warn about shortcut collisions
support shortcut keys without id attribute
provide sync support for custom shortcuts
write tests
library.name: Customizable Shortcuts

library.description: JavaScript Shortcuts Library (jQuery plugin)
library.name: js-shortcuts

library.description: This is a library for normalizing JavaScript key codes across browsers.  It's based on the article "JavaScript Madness: Keyboard Events" by Jan Wolter:
library.name: KeyCode.js

library.description: jShortcuts is free, lightweight and easy to use JavaScript shortcuts library. It is compatible with all modern web browsers and does not require other JavaScript libraries / frameworks.
library.name: jShortcuts

library.description:
Search jQuery plugin with barcode scanner support


Direct search in browser
Search without inputfield
Activate searchfield optional
Activate searchslider optional
Supports barcode scanner
Searchfilter
library.name: anysearch.js

library.description:
Handling Keyboard Shortcuts in JavaScript

Despite the many JavaScript libraries that are available today, I cannot find one that makes it easy to add keyboard shortcuts(or accelerators) to your javascript app. This is because keyboard shortcuts where only used in JavaScript games - no serious web application used keyboard shortcuts to navigate around its interface. But Google apps like Google Reader and Gmail changed that. So, I have created a function to make adding shortcuts to your application much easier.
library.name: Shortcuts.js

library.description: Keyboard shortcuts are a royal pain in JavaScript. This should help.
library.name: keyboard.backbone.js

library.description:
UserKeyboardShortcuts is a refactor of the Keyboard class provided by mootools-more. It makes it easy for you to provide local user-customizable keyboard shortcuts for your users that you don't have to care about.

You just use Keyboard.addShortcuts (provided by Keyboard.Extras) as you usually would, then the user can change the keys to their liking. The assignments they make will be stored using localStorage (failing that a cookie) and will be restored on each subsequent page load.
library.name: UserKeyboardShortcuts

library.description: JQuery Shortcuts Library
library.name: jQuery.shortcut

library.description: A jQuery plugin for adding keyboard shortcuts to a web page
library.name: shortkeys

library.description: Keyboard hotkey/shortcut binding, using custom namespace syntax with any event type.

Requires jquery (tested with 1.3.2 but may work with earlier versions.)

Supports basic keyup / keydown / hold functionality.

library.description:
A very lightweight approach to keyboard shortcuts (hotkeys) with jQuery 
A very lightweight approach to keyboard shortcuts (hotkeys) with jQuery.
library.name: jquery-shortcuts

library.description:
jQuery plugin to translate hotkeys into jQuery events.

This separates hotkeys from the actions to which they are bound. This way one just needs to register an event handler for a given action and not directly for a hotkey. The association between hotkey and action can later be changed without the need of changing the event handler of the action.
library.name: hotkeys

library.description: jQuery plugin that allows you to set arbitrary hotkeys for hyperlinks in your HTML page.
library.name: Arbitrary Hotkeys
